name: Alabaster Dragon

rulings.text: This will always be shuffled into its owner's library.

text:
Flying
When Alabaster Dragon dies, shuffle it into its owner's library.
originalText:
Flying
If Alabaster Dragon is put into your discard pile from play, shuffle Alabaster Dragon back into your deck.

name: Alluring Scent
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
originalText: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to intercept that creature do so.
flavor: Doom rarely smells this sweet.

text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Anaconda can't be intercepted. Swamps are in play regardless of whether they're tapped or untapped.)
name: Anaconda

flavor: Something soft bumped against the rowboat, then was gone.
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Anaconda can't be intercepted.)
name: Anaconda
Ancestral Memories

rulings.text: If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
This is not considered a draw or a discard.

text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
originalText: Look at the top seven cards of your deck. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your discard pile.

name: Angelic Blessing
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
originalText: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until the end of the turn.
flavor: A peasant can do more by faith than a king by proclamation.

name: Archangel
text: Flying, vigilance
originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

text: Vigilance
flavor: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fights for hearth and home.
originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.
name: Ardent Militia
Armageddon
text: Destroy all lands.
originalText: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)
flavor:
"‘O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost

name: Armored Pegasus
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

name: Arrogant Vampire
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: Charm and grace may hide a foul heart.

name: Assassin's Blade
text:
Cast Assassin's Blade only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target nonblack attacking creature.
originalText:
Play Assassin's Blade only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Destroy any one attacking creature that isn't black.

name: Balance of Power

rulings.text: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

text: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
originalText: If you have fewer cards in your hand than your opponent does, draw until you have the same number. (When you play Balance of Power, it doesn't count as in your hand.)

name: Baleful Stare
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
originalText: Look at your opponent's hand. For each mountain and red card there, you draw a card. (You draw from your deck.)

name: Bee Sting
text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any one creature or player.
flavor: There are few things as motivating as a swarm of bees.

name: Blaze
text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.
flavor: Fire never dies alone.

name: Blaze
text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player. (For example, if you tap a mountain plus four other lands when you play Blaze, it deals 4 damage.)

name: Blessed Reversal

rulings.text: The creatures are counted on resolution.

text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
originalText:
Play Blessed Reversal only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
For each attacking creature, you gain 3 life.

name: Blinding Light

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
originalText: Tap all creatures except for white creatures. (This includes your creatures.)
flavor: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.
originalText: Flying
name: Bog Imp

text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Bog Raiders can't be intercepted.)
name: Bog Raiders

text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Bog Wraith can't be intercepted.)
name: Bog Wraith
Boiling Seas
text: Destroy all Islands.
originalText: Destroy all islands. (This includes your islands.)
flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.

name: Border Guard
flavor: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

name: Breath of Life
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
originalText: Take any one summon creature from your discard pile and put that card into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand.

text: Islandwalk
flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.
originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player has any islands in play, Bull Hippo can't be intercepted.)
name: Bull Hippo
Burning Cloak
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.
originalText:
Any one creature gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
Burning Cloak deals 2 damage to that creature.

name: Capricious Sorcerer

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: {T}: Capricious Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Capricious Sorcerer to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

name: Charging Bandits
text: Whenever Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: If Charging Bandits attacks, it gets +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
flavor: The fear in their victims' eyes is their most cherished reward.

name: Charging Paladin
text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
originalText: If Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until the end of the turn.
flavor: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: A rhino rarely uses its horn to announce its charge, only to end it.
originalText: Charging Rhino can't be intercepted by more than one creature.
name: Charging Rhino
Cloak of Feathers
text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
originalText: Any one creature gains flying until the end of the turn. You draw a card.
flavor: A thousand feathers from a thousand birds, sewn with magic and song.

name: Cloud Dragon
text:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can block only creatures with flying.
originalText:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can intercept only creatures with flying.

name: Cloud Pirates
text:
Flying
Cloud Pirates can block only creatures with flying.
originalText:
Flying
Cloud Pirates can intercept only creatures with flying.

name: Cloud Spirit

rulings.text: If it loses Flying, it will be unable to block any creatures.

text:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
originalText:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can intercept only creatures with flying.

name: Command of Unsummoning
text:
Cast Command of Unsummoning only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return one or two target attacking creatures to their owner's hand.
originalText:
Play Command of Unsummoning only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Return any one or two attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

name: Coral Eel
flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

name: Craven Giant
text: Craven Giant can't block.
originalText: Craven Giant can't intercept.
flavor:
"The best armor is to keep out of range."
—Italian proverb

name: Craven Knight
text: Craven Knight can't block.
originalText: Craven Knight can't intercept.
flavor: "I say victory is better than honor."

name: Cruel Bargain
text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
originalText: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up. (For example, if you have 11 life, you lose 6 life.)

name: Cruel Fate
text: Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library. Put one of those cards into that player's graveyard and the rest on top of his or her library in any order.
originalText: Look at the top five cards of your opponent's deck. Put one of them into your opponent's discard pile and the rest on top of his or her deck in any order.

name: Cruel Tutor
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
originalText: Search your deck for any card. Shuffle your deck and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
flavor: The more you pay for the lesson, the better you'll remember it.

name: Deep Wood
text:
Cast Deep Wood only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
originalText:
Play Deep Wood only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

name: Deep-Sea Serpent
text: Deep-Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
originalText: Deep-Sea Serpent can attack only if the defending player has an island in play.
flavor: Sailors fear the deep-sea serpent; others thank the gods it has no legs.

name: Defiant Stand
text:
Cast Defiant Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Target creature gets +1/+3 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
originalText:
Play Defiant Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Any one creature gets +1/+3 until the end of the turn. If that creature is tapped, untap it.

name: Déjà Vu
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one sorcery card from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor: The past is a mirror of the future.

name: Desert Drake
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: Never doubt a dragon just because of its size.

name: Devastation
text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
originalText: Destroy all creatures and lands. (This includes your creatures and lands.)
flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

name: Devoted Hero
flavor: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

name: Djinn of the Lamp
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: Once they learn the trick of carrying their own lamps, they never touch the ground again.

name: Dread Charge
text: Black creatures you control can't be blocked this turn except by black creatures.
originalText: This turn, your black creatures can be intercepted only by other black creatures.
flavor: "As equal were their souls, so equal was their fate." —John Dryden, "Ode to Mrs. Anne Killigrew"

name: Dread Reaper
text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
originalText:
Flying
When Dread Reaper comes into play from your hand, you lose 5 life. (The person who plays Dread Reaper loses the life.)

name: Dry Spell
text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)
flavor: A fist of dust to line your throat, a bowl of sand to fill your belly.

name: Earthquake

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
originalText: Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without flying. (This includes you and your creatures without flying.)

name: Ebon Dragon
text:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.
originalText:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon comes into play from your hand, you may force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

name: Elite Cat Warrior
text: Forestwalk
originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Elite Cat Warrior can't be intercepted. Forests are in play regardless of whether they're tapped or untapped.)

flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."
text: Forestwalk
originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Elite Cat Warrior can't be intercepted.)
name: Elite Cat Warrior
Elven Cache
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one card from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor: Elves know where to harvest the best of the forest, for they planted it themselves.

name: Elvish Ranger
flavor: It's up to you if you enter their woods—and up to them if you leave.

name: Endless Cockroaches
text: When Endless Cockroaches dies, return it to its owner's hand.
originalText: If Endless Cockroaches is put into your discard pile from play, return Endless Cockroaches to your hand.

name: Exhaustion

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
originalText: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping his or her creatures and lands.

name: False Peace
text: Target player skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
originalText: Choose any one player. That player can't attack on his or her next turn.
flavor: Mutual consent is not required for war.

name: Feral Shadow
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

name: Final Strike

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

text:
As an additional cost to cast Final Strike, sacrifice a creature.
Final Strike deals damage to target opponent equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
originalText: Choose one of your creatures. Final Strike deals to your opponent damage equal to that creature's offense. Then, put the creature in your discard pile.

name: Fire Dragon

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield, Fire Dragon will have to target itself. The ability is mandatory.

text:
Flying
When Fire Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
originalText:
Flying
When Fire Dragon comes into play from your hand, it deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play.

name: Fire Imp
text: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
originalText: When Fire Imp comes into play from your hand, it deals 2 damage to any one creature. (If you're the only player with creatures, Fire Imp deals 2 damage to one of your creatures.)

name: Fire Snake
text: When Fire Snake dies, destroy target land.
originalText: If Fire Snake is put into your discard pile from play, destroy any one land.
flavor: The snake's final thrashings only spread the fire within it.

name: Fire Tempest
text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you. If all players drop to 0 life or less, the game is a draw.)

name: Flashfires
text: Destroy all Plains.
originalText: Destroy all plains. (This includes your plains.)
flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

name: Fleet-Footed Monk
text: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
originalText: Fleet-Footed Monk can't be intercepted by any creature with offense 2 or greater.
flavor: "Hesitation is for the faithless. My belief lends me speed."

name: Flux

rulings.text: The discard is forced even though you choose how many to discard.
Each player chooses how many cards he or she would like to discard. That number may be 0.

text:
Each player discards any number of cards, then draws that many cards.
Draw a card.
originalText: Each player chooses and discards from his or her hand any number of cards and then draws that many cards. You then draw a card. (You choose first.)

name: Foot Soldiers
flavor: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

name: Forked Lightning

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you cast Forked Lightning, not as it resolves. Each target you choose must be assigned at least 1 damage.

text: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.
originalText: Forked Lightning deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any one, two, or three creatures.

name: Fruition
text: You gain 1 life for each Forest on the battlefield.
originalText: For each forest you and your opponent have in play, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Come to these woods and suffer no pain; you've burdens to lose and new life to gain.

name: Giant Octopus
flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: It's not far into the trap, as the crow flies.
originalText: Giant Spider can intercept as though it had flying.
name: Giant Spider

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

name: Gift of Estates

rulings.text: Gift of Estates does nothing if each of your opponents has the same number of lands or fewer as you.
You can find nonbasic lands if they have the Plains land type, such as dual lands (Tundra, et al).

text: If an opponent controls more lands than you, search your library for up to three Plains cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: If your opponent has more lands in play than you do, search your deck for up to three plains and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

name: Goblin Bully
flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

name: Gorilla Warrior
flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play from your hand, you may choose to return a summon creature from your discard pile to your hand.
name: Gravedigger

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

name: Hand of Death
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. (A creature is black if it has {B} in its cost.)
flavor: Death claims all but the darkest souls.

name: Hand of Death
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.
flavor: Death claims all but the darkest souls.

name: Harsh Justice
text:
Cast Harsh Justice only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.
originalText:
Play Harsh Justice only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, each attacking creature that damages you also deals equal damage to the attacking player.

name: Highland Giant
flavor: Though slow-witted and slow-moving, they are quick to anger.

name: Hill Giant
flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot!

name: Horned Turtle
flavor: Its spear has no shaft, its shield no handle.

name: Howling Fury
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: Any one creature gets +4/+0 until the end of the turn.
flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
originalText: Hulking Cyclops can't intercept.
name: Hulking Cyclops
Hulking Goblin
text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
originalText: Hulking Goblin can't intercept.
flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

name: Hurricane

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each player and each creature with flying. (This includes you and your creatures with flying.)

name: Ingenious Thief
text:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.
originalText:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief comes into play from your hand, look at your opponent's hand.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Island
originalText: U

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Island
originalText: U

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Island
originalText: U

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Island
originalText: U

name: Jungle Lion
text: Jungle Lion can't block.
originalText: Jungle Lion can't intercept.
flavor: The lion's only loyalty is to its hunger.

name: Keen-Eyed Archers
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
originalText: Keen-Eyed Archers can intercept as though it had flying.
flavor: "If it has wings, shoot it. If it doesn't, shoot it anyway."

name: King's Assassin
text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap King's Assassin to destroy any one tapped creature.
flavor: Fear is as effective a weapon as the blade.

name: Knight Errant
flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

name: Last Chance
text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
originalText: Take another turn after this one. You lose the game at the end of that turn. (You don't lose if you've already won.)

name: Lava Axe
text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to your opponent.
flavor: Swing your axe as a broom, to sweep away the foe.

name: Lava Flow
text: Destroy target creature or land.
originalText: Destroy any one creature or land.
flavor: People ran as never before at the thought of being buried and cremated at the same time.

name: Lizard Warrior
flavor: Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
originalText: When Man-o'-War comes into play from your hand, return any one creature to its owner's hand. (If you're the only one with creatures, return one of them to your hand.)
name: Man-o'-War

rulings.text: It can choose itself. It has to if there are no other creatures.

name: Mercenary Knight
text: When Mercenary Knight enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
originalText: When Mercenary Knight comes into play from your hand, choose and discard a summon creature from your hand or destroy Mercenary Knight.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

name: Mind Knives
text: Target opponent discards a card at random.
originalText: Your opponent discards a card at random from his or her hand.
flavor: To dodge the unerring knife, one must be free of thought.

name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.
originalText: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)

name: Minotaur Warrior
flavor: The herd's patience, the stampede's fury.

name: Mobilize
text: Untap all creatures you control.
originalText: Untap all your creatures.
flavor: A rested mind is the sharpest weapon.

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
originalText: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn. (For example, a 6/3 creature would become 10/7.)

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
originalText: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.
flavor: Some cats are born fighters; others need a little persuading.

name: Moon Sprite
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Mountain
originalText: R

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Mountain
originalText: R

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Mountain
originalText: R

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Mountain
originalText: R

name: Mountain Goat
text: Mountainwalk
originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has any mountains in play, Mountain Goat can't be intercepted.)
flavor: Only the heroic and the mad follow mountain goat trails.

name: Muck Rats
flavor: The difference between a nuisance and a threat is often merely a matter of numbers.

name: Mystic Denial
text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.
originalText: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a summon creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her discard pile.

name: Natural Order

rulings.text: The sacrifice of a green creature is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
You do not have to find a green creature card if you do not want to.

text:
As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your deck for a green summon creature and put that card into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand. Then put one of your green creatures into your discard pile. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

name: Natural Spring
text: Target player gains 8 life.
originalText: You gain 8 life.
flavor: Though many have come to this place to wash their wounds, the water has never turned red.

name: Nature's Cloak
text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn.
originalText: All your green creatures gain forestwalk until the end of the turn. (If defending player has any forests in play, none of your green creatures can be intercepted.)

name: Nature's Lore

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your deck for a forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.
flavor: Nature's secrets can be read on every tree, every branch, every leaf.

name: Nature's Ruin
text: Destroy all green creatures.
originalText: Destroy all green creatures. (This includes your green creatures.)
flavor: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.

name: Needle Storm
text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
originalText: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying. (This includes your creatures with flying.)

name: Noxious Toad
text: When Noxious Toad dies, each opponent discards a card.
originalText: If Noxious Toad is put into your discard pile from play, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

name: Omen
text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
originalText: Look at the top three cards of your deck and return them in any order. You may choose to shuffle your deck. Then draw a card.

name: Owl Familiar
text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
originalText:
Flying
When Owl Familiar comes into play from your hand, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

name: Panther Warriors
flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

name: Path of Peace

rulings.text: If the spell fails because the target is not there or isn't legal, the owner does not gain any life.

text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
originalText: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.
flavor: The soldier reaped the profits of peace.

name: Personal Tutor

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text: Search your library for a sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
originalText: Search your deck for a sorcery and reveal that card to all players. Shuffle your deck and put the revealed card on top of it.

text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.
originalText: Phantom Warrior can't be intercepted.
name: Phantom Warrior
Pillaging Horde
text: When Pillaging Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
originalText: When Pillaging Horde comes into play from your hand, discard a card at random from your hand or destroy Pillaging Horde.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Plains
originalText: W

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Plains
originalText: W

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Plains
originalText: W

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Plains
originalText: W

name: Plant Elemental
text: When Plant Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice a Forest.
originalText: When Plant Elemental comes into play from your hand, destroy one of your forests or destroy Plant Elemental.

name: Primeval Force
text: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.
originalText: When Primeval Force comes into play from your hand, destroy three of your forests or destroy Primeval Force.

name: Prosperity

rulings.text: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

text: Each player draws X cards.
originalText: Each player draws X cards.
flavor: "Life can never be too good."

name: Pyroclasm
text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
originalText: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)
flavor: Chaos does not choose its enemies.

name: Python
flavor: What could it have swallowed to grow so large?

name: Raging Cougar
text: Haste
originalText: Raging Cougar is unaffected by summoning sickness.
flavor: Mountaineers quickly learn to travel with their spears always pointed up.

text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
originalText: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness. (It can attack the turn you play it, unless another card prevents this.)
name: Raging Goblin

flavor: Charging alone takes uncommon daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
originalText: Raging Goblin is unaffected by summoning sickness.
name: Raging Goblin
Raging Minotaur
text: Haste
originalText: Raging Minotaur is unaffected by summoning sickness.
flavor: The only thing worse than a minotaur with an axe is an angry minotaur with an axe.

name: Rain of Salt

rulings.text: You must target two different lands. You can't choose to target just one.

text: Destroy two target lands.
originalText: Destroy any two lands.
flavor:
It pelts the land with its fury,
spoiling what was once sweet.

name: Rain of Tears
text: Destroy target land.
originalText: Destroy any one land.
flavor: When emotions rain down, what rivers will be born?

name: Raise Dead

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one summon creature from your discard pile to your hand.
flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

name: Redwood Treefolk
flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

name: Regal Unicorn
flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

name: Renewing Dawn
text: You gain 2 life for each Mountain target opponent controls.
originalText: For each mountain your opponent has in play, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Dawn brings a new day, and a new day brings hope.

name: Rowan Treefolk
flavor: One of the forest's best protectors is the forest itself.

name: Sacred Knight
text: Sacred Knight can't be blocked by black and/or red creatures.
originalText: Sacred Knight can't be intercepted by black or red creatures.
flavor: "No flame, no horror can sway me from my cause."

name: Sacred Nectar
text: You gain 4 life.
originalText: You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

name: Scorching Spear
text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any one creature or player.
flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

name: Scorching Winds
text:
Cast Scorching Winds only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
originalText:
Play Scorching Winds only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
Scorching Winds deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
originalText: If Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may choose to tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't intercept.)
name: Seasoned Marshal

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

name: Serpent Assassin
text: When Serpent Assassin enters the battlefield, you may destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: When Serpent Assassin comes into play from your hand, you may choose to destroy any one creature that isn't black.

text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
originalText: When Serpent Warrior comes into play from your hand, you lose 3 life. (The person who plays Serpent Warrior loses the life.)
name: Serpent Warrior

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Skeletal Crocodile
flavor: The less flesh there is, the more teeth there seem to be.

name: Skeletal Snake
flavor: They watched as the snake shed layer after layer until only cold bone remained.

text: Flying
flavor: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.
originalText: Flying
name: Snapping Drake
Sorcerous Sight
text:
Look at target opponent's hand.
Draw a card.
originalText: Look at your opponent's hand. You draw a card. (Draw the card from your deck.)
flavor: Do not react; anticipate.

name: Soul Shred
text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
originalText: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.
flavor: It would be a shame to let life slip away to nothing.

name: Spined Wurm
flavor: It has more teeth than fit in its mouth.

name: Spiritual Guardian
text: When Spiritual Guardian enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
originalText: When Spiritual Guardian comes into play from your hand, you gain 4 life.
flavor: Hope is born within.

name: Spitting Earth
text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
originalText: Spitting Earth deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountains.)

name: Spotted Griffin
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.

text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: No one is happy when they notice a tiger.
originalText: Stalking Tiger can't be intercepted by more than one creature.
name: Stalking Tiger
Starlight
text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
originalText: For each black creature your opponent has in play, you gain 3 life.
flavor: Stars are like coins dropped into the night: their light buys safe passage.

name: Starlit Angel
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: To soar as high as hope, to dive as swift as justice.

name: Steadfastness
text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +0/+3 until the end of the turn.
flavor: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

name: Stern Marshal

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Stern Marshal to give any one creature +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.
originalText: Destroy any one land.
flavor:
I cast a thousand tiny suns—
Beware my many dawns.

text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending.  Storm crow departing, summer is starting.
originalText: Flying
name: Storm Crow
Summer Bloom

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
originalText: Take up to three lands from your hand and put them into play.
flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

name: Sylvan Tutor

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
originalText: Search your deck for a summon creature and reveal that card to all players. Then shuffle your deck and put the revealed card on top of it.

name: Symbol of Unsummoning
text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
originalText: Return any one creature to its owner's hand. You draw a card.
flavor:
". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ."
—Kate Chopin, The Awakening

name: Taunt
text: During target player's next turn, creatures that player controls attack you if able.
originalText: Choose any one player. On that player's next turn, all his or her creatures that can attack you must do so.

name: Temporary Truce
text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
originalText: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two any player draws, that player gains 2 life. (You choose whether to draw first.)

name: Theft of Dreams
text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
originalText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
flavor: Energy is never lost, only transformed.

name: Thing from the Deep
text: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.
originalText: If Thing from the Deep attacks, destroy one of your islands or destroy Thing from the Deep.
flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.

name: Thundering Wurm
text: When Thundering Wurm enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.
originalText: When Thundering Wurm comes into play from your hand, discard a land from your hand or destroy Thundering Wurm.

name: Thundermare
text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
originalText:
Thundermare is unaffected by summoning sickness. 
When Thundermare comes into play from your hand, tap all other creatures. (This includes your creatures.)

name: Tidal Surge
text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
originalText: Tap any one, two, or three creatures without flying. (Tapped creatures can't intercept.)
flavor:
"'Twas  when the seas were roaring
With hollow blasts of wind . . . ."
—John Gay, "The What D'Ye Call It"

name: Time Ebb
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
originalText: Return any one creature to the top of its owner's deck.
flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

name: Touch of Brilliance
text: Draw two cards.
originalText: Draw two cards.
flavor: Acting on one good idea is better than hoarding all the world's knowledge.

name: Treetop Defense
text:
Cast Treetop Defense only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)
originalText:
Play Treetop Defense only after you're attacked, before you declare interceptors.
This turn, all your creatures can intercept as though they had flying.

name: Undying Beast
text: When Undying Beast dies, put it on top of its owner's library.
originalText: If Undying Beast is put into your discard pile from play, put Undying Beast on top of your deck.

name: Untamed Wilds

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your deck for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

name: Valorous Charge
text: White creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: All white creatures get +2/+0 until the end of the turn. (This includes other players' white creatures.)
flavor: Stand in the way of truth at your peril.

name: Vampiric Feast
text: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.
originalText: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to any one creature or player. You gain 4 life.
flavor: It's not always gold the thief is after.

name: Vampiric Touch
text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to target opponent and you gain 2 life.
originalText: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to your opponent. You gain 2 life.
flavor: A touch, not comforting, but of death.

text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.
originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play from your hand, you gain 2 life.
name: Venerable Monk
Vengeance
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
originalText: Destroy any one tapped creature.
flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

name: Virtue's Ruin
text: Destroy all white creatures.
originalText: Destroy all white creatures. (This includes your white creatures.)
flavor: All must fall, and those who stand highest fall hardest.

name: Volcanic Dragon
text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
originalText:
Flying
Volcanic Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.

name: Volcanic Hammer
text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.
flavor: Cast the weight as though it were a die, to see a rival's fate.

name: Wall of Granite
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
originalText: Wall of Granite can't attack.
flavor: The wisest man builds his house behind the rock.

text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.
originalText:
Flying
Wall of Swords can't attack.
name: Wall of Swords
Warrior's Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn. (For example, a 1/2 creature would become 2/3.)

name: Warrior's Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.
flavor: It is not the absence of fear that makes a warrior, but its domination.

name: Whiptail Wurm
flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

name: Wicked Pact
text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
originalText: Destroy any two creatures that aren't black. You lose 5 life. (You can't play Wicked Pact unless you can choose two creatures to destroy.)

name: Willow Dryad
text: Forestwalk
originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has any forests in play, Willow Dryad can't be intercepted.)
flavor: Some think that dryads are the dreams of trees.

text: Flying
flavor: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings." —William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
originalText: Flying
name: Wind Drake
Winds of Change

rulings.text: Each player draws a number of cards equal to the number of cards he or she shuffled into his or her own library.

text: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
originalText: Each player counts the cards in his or her hand, shuffles those cards into his or her deck, and then draws that many cards. (When you play Winds of Change, it doesn't count as a card in your hand.)

name: Winter's Grasp
text: Destroy target land.
originalText: Destroy any one land.
flavor: Winter settles on the land, and the land prays it will wake.

name: Withering Gaze
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.
originalText: Look at your opponent's hand. For each forest and green card there, you draw a card. (You draw from your deck.)

text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: When Wood Elves comes into play from your hand, search your deck for a forest and put that card into play. Shuffle your deck afterwards.
name: Wood Elves

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

name: Wrath of God
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
originalText: Put all creatures into their owners' discard piles. (This includes your creatures.)
flavor:
"As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods. They kill us for their sport."
—William Shakespeare, King Lear
